title.native: イド：インヴェイデッド

description:
Welcome to Kura, an organization that investigates crime using the Mizuhanome system which senses the drive to kill. Sakaido is a brilliant detective and pilot of the Mizuhanome. To solve a case, he enters the world of the killer's unconscious mind: the id well. In the shadows of brutal and puzzling cases lurks John Walker, the Serial Killer Creator. Where will Sakaido's pursuit lead?

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

name.native: ブリドカット・セーラ・恵美

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsuiyotsuitaro) 

Outarou Maijou is a Japanese novelist.

__Height:__ 168 cm
__Likes:__ Winter, Video Games, Blobfish, Cats, Beef, Ramen, Cheesecake
__Dislikes:__ Summer, Corn
__Favorite Artists:__ [BUMP OF CHICKEN](https://anilist.co/staff/109225/BUMP-OF-CHICKEN), [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954/One-Ok-Rock), [Sekai no Owari](https://anilist.co/staff/121606/Sekai-no-Owari), [YUI](https://anilist.co/staff/100287/Yui), [DOES](https://anilist.co/staff/104260/DOES) and [Porno Graffitti](https://anilist.co/staff/102716/Porno-Graffitti)

__[Website](https://sou-official.jp/)__ | __[Profile (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/sou/biography/)__  | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nico_nico_sou)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLAhLxCcqi5afnNTQNnfX-g)__

__Introduction:__
Sou is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Universal Music Japan (2019-), having previously been under EXIT TUNES (2015-2016) and Saihate Records (2016-2019). Prior to 2015, he was to perform as an utaite on the site Nico Nico Douga.

__Biography:__
On October 2013, he started performing as a singer on the video uploading site Nico Nico Douga. He was only 15 years old at the time. Two years later on December 2, 2015, he made his major debut with the release of his first album titled "[Suisou Regulus](https://open.spotify.com/album/1shHHMbW5b08I9HZTPIeMY)" through the record label EXIT TUNES.

After his major debut in 2015, he would release other works in collaboration with other utaite such as Nayutan, [Harumaki Gohan](https://twitter.com/harumaki_gohan) and [Eve](https://anilist.co/staff/132869/Eve), while also forming and participating in music unit "[Okaeritte Ie](https://utaite.fandom.com/wiki/Category:Okaeritte_Ie)" with utaite Wolpis Carter and Isubokuro. As of July 2019, he has accumulated over 4.5 million views on his cover of Eve's song titled "Literary Nonsense", and 13 million views on his cover of Chouchou-P's song titled "Kokoronashi". Both becoming quite popular through the tides of time.

On March 2019, he released his first song "Parade of Fools", which he himself wrote and composed, while on May of the same year, he made his first one-man live performance with "Salir" at the Akasaka Blitz in Tokyo, Japan.

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou), edited | [Fandom (Utaite)](https://utaite.fandom.com/wiki/Sou), edited)

[Website](https://miyavi.com/)  | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyavi_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miyavi_ishihara/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/MIYAVI.OFFlCIAL/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCC_nn4TlgMKp2li_kvUcWsg) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7sBtBCNVRujQhaHDODkfTN)

Takamasa Ishihara, otherwise better known by stage name Miyavi, is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, lyricist, composer, actor, record producer, and businessman. He is known for his finger-slapping style of playing a guitar. He has been active since 1999, first as guitarist for the now defunct visual kei rock band Dué le Quartz and then as a solo artist starting in 2002. 

In 2007, he became a member of the rock supergroup S.K.I.N., and in 2009 founded his own company, J-Glam. He toured worldwide several times, with over 250 shows in 30 countries as of 2015. As of 2016, he has released ten solo albums and 27 singles.

[Website](https://miyavi.com/)  | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyavi_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miyavi_ishihara/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/MIYAVI.OFFlCIAL/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCC_nn4TlgMKp2li_kvUcWsg) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7sBtBCNVRujQhaHDODkfTN)

Takamasa Ishihara, otherwise better known by stage name Miyavi, is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, lyricist, composer, actor, record producer, and businessman. He is known for his finger-slapping style of playing a guitar. He has been active since 1999, first as guitarist for the now defunct visual kei rock band Dué le Quartz and then as a solo artist starting in 2002. 

In 2007, he became a member of the rock supergroup S.K.I.N., and in 2009 founded his own company, J-Glam. He toured worldwide several times, with over 250 shows in 30 countries as of 2015. As of 2016, he has released ten solo albums and 27 singles.

__[Website](http://atsushiumebori.fr/)__

__Atsushi Umebori__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.

name.native: スワベック・コバレフスキ

node.description:
Award-winning Polish composer and pianist based in Tokyo. His work on major film and broadcast productions includes original scores for NHK, Fuji Television, TV Tokyo, and TBS networks, as well as Japan’s top pop act, AKB48, and covers a wide range of musical genre, ranging from full classical orchestral scores to Japanese traditional, piano solo, jazz, electronic, minimal, and avant-garde.

Slavek began playing piano at five, but his family’s move from Communist Poland to Western Germany when he was ten was the key factor in expanding his musical horizons beyond the conventional: Slavek played in bands (alternating guitar, drums, and bass), studied the sitar from Shalil Shankar, and produced punk albums, all while continuing to win prizes for his piano playing. On the strength of a single audition, he was accepted into the Conservatory van Amsterdam, where he received a rigorous education in classical music under the tutelage of the great pianist Håkon Austbø. Later, he went on to study counterpoint, orchestration, and scoring for film, from multiple-award-winning composer Jurre Haanstra.

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/seiji.fukunaga.96)__

__Residency:__ Narashino City, Chiba Prefecture, Japan

__Seiji Fukunaga__ is a Japanese CG Director and producer working at VISUALMAN TOKYO Co., LTD.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsuiyotsuitaro) 

Outarou Maijou is a Japanese novelist.
